It is characterized by half-timbered buildings with exposed wood beams, ornate chimneys, and steeply pitched roofs. Tudor architecture is known for its symmetry, often featuring large, decorative chimneys on each end of the building, and large mullioned windows.

He believed in the importance of traditional craftsmanship and rejected industrialization and mass production. Morris's architectural work was largely limited to designing interiors and furnishings for his own homes and those of his friends.

His Arts and Crafts work was characterized by clean lines, simple geometric forms, and an emphasis on natural materials. He was a key member of the Arts and Crafts Exhibition Society and the author of several influential books on architecture and design.

His style was characterized by a distinctive blend of traditional Scottish motifs, Japanese design, and modernist simplicity. His most famous works include the Glasgow School of Art, the Hill House, and the Willow Tea Rooms.

The style seeks to create a sense of place by integrating local traditions and vernacular architecture with contemporary design principles.

architects.name: Frank Lloyd Wright
architects.description: One of the most influential architects of the 20th century, Wright was known for his organic architecture style that emphasized a harmonious relationship between the built environment and nature.

architects.name: Le Corbusier
architects.description: A pioneer of the modern architecture movement, Le Corbusier was known for his functionalist approach to design and his belief that architecture should meet the needs of society.
notable_buildings: Chapel of Notre Dame du Haut

architects.name: Bjarke Ingels
architects.description: A postmodern architect known for his innovative and sustainable designs, Ingels is the founder of the Bjarke Ingels Group (BIG), an architecture firm with offices around the world.

style.description: Stilt Houses are dwellings that are elevated off the ground on stilts or pillars. They are commonly found in areas that experience flooding, high tides, or heavy snowfall. They can be made of various materials such as wood, bamboo, metal or concrete.
characteristics: The main feature of the Stilt House architecture style is the use of stilts or pillars to elevate the house above the ground. Other common characteristics include a simple and compact design
and a low-pitched roof that slopes downward to shed water. The houses can be either permanent or temporary structures
depending on the needs of the residents.
